creator: webmaster@i-xplore.com
text:
It seems that the index.shtml filename is always appended to the end of the 
URI/URL.
The following was specified in httpd.conf file:

Redirect permanent /destinations http://192.168.1.26:8080/specials
Redirect permanent /destinations http://192.168.1.26:8080/specials/index.html
 
When redirected, the coresponding shows in the browser address bar:

http://192.168.1.26:8080/specials/index.shtml
http://192.168.1.26:8080/specials/index.html/index.shtml

This causes the NOT FOUND statement.

You must have something else going on in your configuration.  Apache
certainly doesn't append index.shtml to URLs unless you ask for it.

Plus, the configuration that you quoted doesn't make any sense.
You can't redirect the same url-path to two different places.

I believe you have a configuration problem.  The best place to discuss that is
a user support forum such as
http://httpd.apache.org/userslist.html

Thanks for using Apache!
creator: slive@apache.org
webmaster@i-xplore.com
text:
Sorry for the confusion.
